definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
progress step by step/gradual progress/to move forward (slowly)
amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), aka motor neurone disease (MND)
to speed up gradually/faster and faster/(music) accelerando

sentences.english: The chilly winter is far away and the spring is coming on.

sentences.english: It is also due to this "gradualness" that one is able to reconcile himself to his reduced circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 人之能堪受境遇的变衰，也全靠这“渐”的助力。

sentences.english: For you i am pining myself away without regret.

sentences.english: Sleep gradually claimed us and brought gentle, restful dreams.
sentences.chinese: 睡意渐浓，安睡后，我们做了不少愉快的美梦。

sentences.english: Rereading it has no intention of the love letters, long time gradually old youth.
sentences.chinese: 无意重读那年的情书，时光悠悠青春渐老。

sentences.english: Neon lights gleamed in the deepening mists.

sentences.english: The Mid-Autumn Festival is near, coolness comes, you may be safe.

sentences.english: The waves have become clamorous, and upon the bank in the shady lane the yellow leaves flutter and fall.

sentences.english: Ming, Grand court in the Central Division of the judicial power of the three gradually weakened.

sentences.english: A conical diffuser has been widely used in mechanical and mine engineering.
